This is a nice beach shade once it is up but just be aware that setup is slightly confusing and involved There are three separate tent poles and the sleeves you need to slide them into arent very well designed  theyre a mesh material which sort of binds on the poles whereas a solid nylon fabric would have allowed the poles to slide more easily I would also skip using the stakes  theyre terribly cheap and bendable and any sort of rock or resistance will stop them in their tracks Just weigh it down with the included sandbags by placing them inside the tent or just use your beach gear to weigh it down Once it is up and stably in place its a nice beach shade  very roomy widthwise and heightwise with a huge front door that doubles as an extended floor Blocked the sun well too The welldesigned back door is important for air flow It seems wellconstructed overall You may never get it back into its original bag ever again by the way This is a common problem with tents but this one is really bad  especially considering youll be trying to fold it up on a sometimes windy beach Id just get a separate tote bag and shove it inside that instead Overall recommended Just realize this is NOT a simple popup shade and will take some time to construct 
This arrived last week so we havent put it to its paces at the beach yet but I did want to note a couple of things First this was fairly simple to put together but it took a bit of tugging to get the poles threaded on the first try We liked that it can close up if anyone needs to change and we could let someone lay down inside if they needed a break from the sun I also like that there is a screen at the back so we can get a breeze going without losing all of the shade Its low inside  no standing up and it would definitely be a better shade for beach height chairs than regular chairs I found it somewhat tricky to get small enough to get back into the carrying bag even following the directions I was able to ultimately get it zipped into the bag but it took a bit of wrestling I will probably not bother putting it back into the bag while were packing up at the beach but will shake it out when we get back home and then put it away All in all I feel like this was a good purchase for the money

Amazon shipped us a defective product We got the tent for a beach trip on the east coast and had it shipped to our destination When we opened it up everything looked fine  packaging was intact etc However when we went to assemble the shock cord for one of the black poles was broken already We tried to restring it but couldnt feed enough of it through the pole to grab on the other end So we made do and assembled the pole without the string to keep it together Not a big deal but annoying on a brand new purchase The tent worked great once it was up however when we disassembled it the shock cord on the other black pole snapped In case youre wondering I have been a backpacker for 20 years so no user error here  my best guess is that this thing had been sitting in a warehouse too long and the elastic had dryrotted or was just defective Anyway the next day when I was assembling it again the gray pole which is the larger of the 3 poles and handles the arch for the opening one of the pole segments split lengthwise down the middle I got a nice fiberglass splinter out of it too At that point with the black poles not staying together on account of the broken shock cord and the main support losing an entire pole in the middle I gave up on this POS I wrapped it all up and put it in the garbage can on the boardwalk Unfortunately Amazon wont give me a refund since I cant send it back but I wasnt about to waste another 30 minutes of my time trying to repack this useless substandard product Coleman is usually pretty dependable but this one was a total waste of money

Two packs of block ice lasted for 7 days until it was completely gone Drained the cooler once per day Mix of being in the car and outside in temps from 5070 Fantastic cooler Great alternative to the Yeti if you want a good camping cooler Pro tip Buy two blocks of ice put them in a cooler Next line the inside of the cooler with a black garbage bag Now line it with a second one The ice should be sitting below the garbage bags outside of them Place your food inside the garbage bags That will keep your food from getting wet You will need to change the garbage bags after 3 days or so due to condensation from the food packaging and what not But the melting ice will not get the food wet

I was back and forth between a shady tent or a giant umbrella I couldnt be happier that I went with this choice It takes a few minutes to set up Im sure Itll faster as time goes by The quality is definitely Coleman We took this to the beach on a very sunny but windy day The set up was a challenge as the wind kept us on our toes The anchors were useless with so much wind but we had coolers and bags that we used to weigh everything down We spent most of the day half in and half out playing card games reading books and enjoying the beach It was perfect for 2 adults and a 9 year old But I did spend some time people watching What I saw made me love our shady tent more I watched as people clung to their umbrellas as they tipped and flopped I watched as peoples towels were blown over and hat flying off in a swoop And I watched as people tried to eat without getting a gust of sand to add to their snacks Without the sides to protect us from the wind we wouldve taken part in that mess Instead we just got to kick back and enjoy the day The size is way smaller and lighter than an umbrella with a good anchor would be AND it actually fits back in the bag feel like that never happens The cost of this little guy is totally worth it We plan to bring it on our next camping trip and our 9 year old wants to sleep in it so we may just set it up in her room one day  AND it actually fits back in the bag feel like that never happens

We purchased this Coleman Beach Shade tent last year and have used it about three times now So far it has held up to our use pretty well It can be a little tricky to put up and will probably be aggravating for you the first time you set it up I suggest practicing before you go to the beach After becoming familiar with it I can put it up by myself in about 10 minutes It helps to have an extra hand at the beach especially because it is more windy there When we purchased ours and set it up the first time we noticed two small holes in the side of it I used some seam tape on the holes to help it from tearing or opening up more and that did the trick for us Its pretty roomy and a bit bigger than most of the instant shelters that I have seen The front can be zipped up and there is a back window that can also be covered I wanted this one mostly because of those features as it would allow for us to change clothes inside and not have to use the dirty public rest rooms that are at the beach It can get hot inside especially when the back window is closed but with the front and back open it provides good wind flow through the tent There are netted pockets in the corners of the tent and it comes with small sandbags to assist in holding it down Directions for putting the tent up can be found sewn to the inside of the tent bag and they are pretty easy to follow The tent also has guy lines and stakes included Overall we are pretty pleased with it but it does take a little longer to put up than some of the instant shade shelters Its roomy provides good UV protection and we like that we can use it to change clothes inside 
It is very easy to set up but the longer pole can be a little bit of a pain in the butt the first few times youre breaking it in The entire thing is light weight and easily moved around to avoid the sun after you set it up We havent used it in the sand yet but I imagine we will need to weight it down with a cooler and a few other items if it is even remotely windy Very happy with the purchase Update 81216 We bought this for our beach trip 730168916 The first day we used it on the beach it broke while being taken down Every single eyelet fell right out of the thing Ive never been so mad about an item before As long as it was up it was just fine but a little sand apparently makes the thing self destruct I wanted a replacement but apparently there is only a 1 month and 8 day warranty on this item as my ability to replacereturn ended on 84 while we were still 1000 miles from home

I bought these so I could have a set of short lines for my outdoor volleyball net they work fine but there are a few things to note They arent marked so you will need to measure them out and mark them so you can adjust them to the right length Also the way they are designed the center buckle is not going to be under the net as a reference when you shorten them for tandem play Like I said they work but know what you have to do and what you have to deal with Premeasuring isnt such a big deal to me but the fact that the buckle is not under the net is a problem It is just annoying that it is not centered to make laying the lines and referencing easy the real problem is the buckle is now in the area of play So you can step on it Also the extra strap is just left to dangle about when you adjust the lines More expensive 2 prolines dont have these quirks I plan on buying a set of the more expensive 2 lines and just keeping these as a backup for myself I should have spent the extra 20 or so dollars for the better setup since I play all the time

Ive been camping ever since I was a kid and I remember my family always using Coleman products for these events I had a camping themed Christmas this year because I wanted to stock up on supplies to take my own family to the great outdoors One of the items I asked for was this set of enamel plates from Coleman Upon inspecting them I noticed a lot of enamel paint chips in the bottom of the box Two of the cups have large sections in which the enamel coating is missing This doesnt look like a packaging or shipping defectit looks like poor quality on how they were coated Some of the bowels and plates have runs in the coating as wellbut at least it is covered What surprises me is that all the contents in this box was hand packed It is made in China and it looks like they would at least throw the bad cups out when they were packing them in the box The section in which there is no enamel is pretty darn noticeable Everything else seems fine My box might be a fluke but it was pretty disappointing to see that the quality was not what I expected The runs in the paint coating and the uneven layers make me think that this are not going to last very long The silverware seems to be ok and I like that it comes in a protective pouch to keep it organized These items havent been field tested yet but just on inspecting them by handI think I would of gone with something else

I dont recommend hanging this bag or using the shower head Its difficult to hang high enough and the nozzle wastes water as you slide it inout to turn the flow onoff a pushbutton would have been better Some brands of these bags have builtin chemical thermometers which change colors to indicate temperature but the way I use this bag it isnt necessary As an easy and cheap way to heat up water this is great Fill and leave in a sunny spot The water can actually get too hot so check it before letting the kids bathe Add cold water until acceptable  cooler than youd want at home in order to allow more people to shower per bag It saves a lot of time and fuel over heating that much cold water on a stove We dispense a third to a half of the heated water into a collapsable bucket and add coldhot water eg from stove to bring it to a comfortable temperature Use a cup to scoop the water for bathing This method not only conserves water allows accurate temperature control but allows you to ration the water It would be difficult to pour boiling water in the bag directly if it wasnt warm enough eg you dont get back to camp until sunset and the water has already cooled somewhat Ive found that using the nozzle one person may consume 34 the bag one big friend used the entire 5 gal By splitting and using a cup 23 adults can thoroughly bathe with 5gal When rationing smaller amounts we tell folks to bring their water bottle cold water with them in case they run out Our family of five is served with a single 5gal bag by adding coldhot water We keep the kettle on while folks are bathing and can all shower one after the other with no waiting for the water to heat on the stove We use a fullsize house kettle not a dinky camping kettle I also own a Zodi shower propane water heater but dont even use it anymore as this simple lowtech method is sufficient faster and packs better For the shower tent the popup style one didnt last we now use one with proper steel poles and its much better albeit large to pack But whenever theres a strong wind the popup wouldnt hold up Also the popup seemed colder because the wind seemed to pass through the flimsy nylon too easily I dont remember what brand we used to have for the popup but heres the shower stall we use now recommendednbspa datahookproductlinklinked classalinknormal hrefTexsportInstantPortableOutdoorCampingShowerPrivacyShelterChangingRoomdpB000ITVSSQrefcmcrarpdrvwtxtieUTF8Texsport Instant Portable Outdoor Camping Shower Privacy Shelter Changing Rooma

i got this product from walmart about 2 years ago Ive used it probably about 50 times its kinda heavy it inflates easy holds air well and im not sure if its big in comparison to other pads all i know is im looking for something lighter Ive used this pad every time Ive gone hiking or camping or even backpacking it has NEVER failed me it makes the night alot easier if inflated enough you cannot just let it inflate by itself i let mine inflate and then i add a few extra puffs of air until its filled right you cant fill it too much or else it kinda becomes a ballon all in all im happy with it and if you need something just to go camping not backpacking then definitely buy this its quality update i got a new sleeping pad today a lightweight sleeping pad that still has more padding than this sleeping pad the air in the Coleman moves around too much so any weight you put on it in that spot the air just moves out of the way still would not recommend 
After blowing through what seemed more than our fair share of air mattresses I decided to take a different tack I remembered my fathers armyissue pad that inflated and was comfortable on hard surfaces I was much lighter at the time so that may have played some role I was happy when I found these and I bought two since they seemed so similar to what I had in mind The products description is right It does self inflate The problem is what you do after they self inflate You can leave the valve open but then you have no padding Or you close out the valve and you trap the air in The problem is that the air rushes around to where there is no pressure on the pad and you again have no padding but this time you have ballooning where the air rushed to Basically your padding becomes a foot support These were returned the next day I do no recommend this product If I were to make a recommendation to the manufacturer I would tell them to find a way to isolate the air so that it actually creates padding where it is needed One way would be to create chambers so that air movement would be restricted As is the product is useless for my purposes and I am having trouble imagining a situation where it would not be I went and bought another air mattress the next day 
It was difficult at first how to set the tent up because the directions are a little complicated but after finally completing it the first time you wont forget Its a great looking tent This is my first time ordering anything like this and with kids I hope it lasts The tent is well made and the multiple features of opening doors and screen door features are cool Its much bigger than I had anticipated too  the only bad thing I can say is that its really hard to fold the whole thing back into compact form in order to make it all fit back into its carrying bag Its not something that you can just throw into a bag so you may either have to buy a big carrying bag or learn how to fold well  im sure its probably a skill that will need to be developed over time Other than that a great item and Im happy with the purchase 
great product easy to use grandbabies loved it on the beach 
We bought two of these before the recent bad weather It came in handy when the lights went out It doesnt put enough light out to make you forget you dont have power but it is a great purchase nonetheless to take with you from room to room It is light to carry and the casing is strong enough to withstand a drop or two There isnt much of a difference from the hi and lo settings but the light output on either is more than adequate for a battery operated lantern

Well OK I dont sneer at hurricanes But after Hurricane Ike and a week without power we decided to upgrade our emergency lighting to more than flashlights candles and chemical light sticks I bought three of these familysized Coleman lanterns and three MicroPacker lanterns also reviewed The first time I turned on this familysized lantern I said WOW This is a serious light I measured the light output of this lantern Im a photojournalist and discovered it puts out half the light of a bare 40 watt bulb but much much more light than a 25 watt bulb That is plenty of light for reading and walking around like a human being instead of stumbling around with flashlights The low setting is almost as bright as the high setting only onehalf stop dimmer but extends the battery life from 17 hours to a fantastic 28 hours I figure one set 8 of fresh D cells should last though a week of dark nights The familysized lantern is tough and wellmade Its not waterproof but I wouldnt worry about taking it out into the rain It doesnt have rubber seals but the nice tight fittings should keep it dry One minor point the large clear housing is a Coleman tradition but a simple clear cylinder would be more streamlined and compact The lantern is about the size of a fullsized gas mantle unit I wouldnt backpack with it but it is a great unit for emergencies and base camps Now if Coleman only made a batterypowered air conditioner

A lantern in camp is a wonderful thing if youve got a place to put it Preferably the lantern will be above your head so it can give the greatest amount of light and away from people who might bump into it and tip it over This little device allows you to wrap the length of chain around a nearby tree trunk and then hang you lantern high enough to do the most good Its also a handy hanger for your wet towel during the daylight hours Just make sure that there arent any combustable materials read dry branches too close overhead You dont want to use your lantern to start a fire This is one of the must have items that doesnt add any weight to your packing but really adds a lot of convenience I recommend this to anyone who uses a lantern

For what you pay and what you get with this cooler it is of EXCELLENT value I did what everyone else probably didlooked at the Yetis and dreamedand drooled Then got a brisk slap across the face from my wife when she thought I might actually pay 600 ON A COOLER Those Yetis may be amazing but those prices are just absurd and cannot be justified by anyone who isnt literally a mountain man or a hunter who needs ice not to freeze for 10 days Most of us normal guys who go weekend camping dont fall into either of those categories and so we turn our Yeti search into a what cooler is also awesome but doesnt cost me my first born child search Ive only ever owned Coleman and Igloo coolers and so that search began with those two When I was underwhelmed with what Igloo had out there I made the switch to Coleman and was immediately impressed by this cooler My search criteria where as follows Metal hinges had an old Igloo with plastic hinges finally blow out on me granted it was a 30yr old cooler so props to Igloo Metal handles Solid handle andor locking mechanism Hard lined and oring sealed The Coleman SteelBelted Cooler fit all of these criteria and was available for the modest price of 80 I deemed the 54 quart to be of substantial size based on the can capacity that is listed in the description I love that Coleman knows their customers and knows we will want to know how many beerI mean soda cans that the cooler can fit Trust me folks Ive beaten this thing up to heck and back on my camp trips and it has performed admirably It can take a hit and keep on going washed of easily with a hose the hard lining wipes out quickly with a paper towel and it kept my ice frozen for 2 days straight Also is a sturdy seat option for when your idiot cousin steals your chair at the campfire

awesome 
Like others have said the current Crescent 15 Degree F bag being sold is a mediumdark blue and charcoal color not lime green and charcoal as pictured The blue panels are diamondrip stop polyester taffeta and the charcoal parts do not appear to be ripstop Its filled with 2 lbs 14 oz of Coletherm hollow core poly fill insulation The net pack weight the bag in the stuff sack is just over 4 lbs I bought two and one weighed 4 lb 05 oz and the other 4 lb 18 oz on a postal scale The stuff sack weights 25 oz so the sleeping bag alone weighs just under 4 lbs which is a good ruleofthumb maximum limit for a sleeping bag to take backpacking It easily can keep you comfortable down to the 15 degree F rating This bag is very compressible for its loft The size in the included stuff sack is 10 diameter and 14 long which most people will find to be an odd size for backpacking However it will fit stuffed into 11001200 cubic inch backpack compartments It easily fits in an 9 x 24 compression sack not included and squeezes down to approx 9 x 17 pack size if you want to attach it outside your pack For the priceweight this bag is a great buy for both general camping and lighttomedium backpacking for 3season use by Boy Scouts Although it is true you can get goosedown bags for the same temperature range that are about 1 lb lighter and more compressible for hardcore backpacking Im generally opposed to down bags for Boy Scouts for several reasons a down is outrageously expensive especially given the likelihood of some rough treatment and short lifespan b a down bag is useless if it gets wet and c they require special cleaning or special soap for home washing My only complaints are that the shell isnt 100 ripstop material and the included stuff sack is an odd size but at a price around 40 bucks both can be forgiven 
Backpacking on the cheap thats how I roll No really I am basically a beginner on a tight budget so Im on the prowl for deals I scoured Amazon and I settled for this Coleman Crescent bag because well Coleman is a name Ive trusted for years Id never heard of the other brands and I really didnt know exactly what I was looking for Not long after I ordered the bag I realized it was supposedly for tall people which I certainly am not Then after talking to my Uncle who has been backpacking for 20 years I started to worry about the 52 pound listed weight of the bag All my fears were for naught though because when the bag arrived I immediately saw that it wasnt the same bag Yes it was a Coleman Crescent but it was blue with a completely different design on the front it was normal sized and it weighed less then 25 pounds It easily fit into the stuff sack and fit perfectly into my 3500 Cuscus Backpack I will warn you however that this bag looks like it will only fit into bigger packs as in 85 litres and higherNeedless to say I spent the entire month of August humping this bag into the mountains up here in the great white north of Washington State It probably only dipped into the low 40s or high 30s at the lowest but I was so hot some nights I had to strip off thermals in the middle of the night As a matter of fact every single time ive used this bag I had to partially unzip it because I woke up in the night too hot So to recap 1The bag isnt too expensive 2The bag they send you is better then the bag described 3 It is fairly lightweight and should fit into or under your large pack or easily strap onto an external frame Ive done both with it 4It keeps you warm at night Winter is around the corner so I should test the 15 degree rating as I backpack deep into fall but Im guessing it will do alright The only knock I have is that there isnt any room to move your legs I know its a mummy bag and all but dang the legs are a little too snug Up next get rid of my 4000 4man dome tent that Im packing in everywhere

This is amazing We bought it for a trip to the beach It takes a little while to get it in terms of assembling but once you get it it is very easy Some tips 1 Put it in the sand wide open and put some bags with sand they come with the tent so that the wind doesnt bother you 2 Put first the black pieces and then the grey one it is much easier 3 Once you have the structure in place open the windows so that it doesnt blow with the wind and put the bags of sand inside the tent since it makes it easier to put the stakes in the sand It is also very easy to disassemble it is very light Not hot inside My baby took great naps inside It is great that it has a floor to keep the sand out Since it has two openings in the front and back it doesnt get too hot inside

This handsome and sturdy Coleman cooler is over all a better product than our similar Coleman chest it has replaced That chest lasted for at least fifteen years of camping trips travel and weekly runs to the grocery store and the meat market The new chest has a tighter seal around the rim and a more positive rotary lock True this cooler is not designed for bouncing around a truck bed Neither is any cooler comparable to a good refrigerator for keeping things cold Shoppers who do not require big and tough coolers holding lots of ice or dry ice for extended trips and who do not want to pay Yeti level prices will find this Coleman cooler to be useful and a reasonable value

I have used this Coleman 5Gallon PVC Camp Shower on many occasions while camping in various altitudes in multiple locations at differing weather albeit mostly in spring and summer Basically it works well to heat up water and while the shower head is tiny and water flows slowly it is a great help to have warm showers while camping We also use it for washing dishes as warmer water tends to do the job better However after repeated use it can leak as it did for us so we got new one after many uses But given the low price I think it is worth it  we treat it as a semidisposable product that we can use for many showers but certainly not something that will last forever With realistic expectations you are likely to be pleased

This is a very cool little boat Its fun to use comes with the paddle and is very maneuverable The only drawback is that some water will splash over the sides so youll most likely be sitting in a little puddle The place to stash gear is kind of small but if you keep everything in a drybag you dont have to worry about it getting wet and the cargo net should keep it secure People have mentioned that the paddle can break easily In my opinion thats probably a result of not pushing the metal ends all the way into the black plastic handle parts If you push them in all the way and tighten them down there will be plenty of purchase I cant imagine the paddle breaking under normal use if its put together all the way A longer paddle would be nice though because it will drip on you By the way if you dont inflate the backrest all the way you can make it a little more comfortable for just lounging The only improvements Id like to see are another cargo area behind the seat larger tracking fins more attachment areas so you can tie off to other inflatable boats and a longer paddle but asis its still a great little inflatable boat and lots of fun to use Ive owned this boat for probably 6 or seven years now Ive taken it down the floatable parts of the Yakima River in Washington at least 6 times and also on a handful of other day trips to the lake Its never leaked any air and continues to hold up well

We have both the Coleman 1person and 2person inflatables and I would recommend the 2person any day even for someone who intended to go solo It just handles much better because it has bigger skegs on the bottom which keep it tracking straighter Other than that drawback weve enjoyed the single one too but its much slower even if youre floating with the current 
This has proved to be a nice item for family recreation I have several of these for group outings The kids just love them The kayaks are quite stable easy to manuever and a novice can easily handle them  Compared with canoes and hardshell kayaks they are more forgiving much easier to transport but quite slow You can plan on traveling about 1 mile per hour without current You will not be able to make much progress up stream or into a stiff wind They have done well on afternoon outings on tame rivers and lakes but definately not built for big water or whitewater The kayaks have proved reasonably durable but I have had to patch several pinholes

Weve taken it camping several times and it works great Heres what you have to do to maximize its use and life First we through a rope with a log on it over a tree limb and tied it to the shower bag Then lower the rope so that you can fill the bag After pull the rope so it goes back up to your desired height Place a stake in the ground to hold the shower rope and maintain the height We take five individual one gallon jugs and fill up the shower bag two gallons at a time No need to have five gallons for one shower If your setup is done correctly it will be easy to refill before each shower You can leave the jugs in the sun for the same effect

I have used this two years now for my camping beach trips and its been a great little cabana Its not my favorite but its getting 5 stars because is holds up well to extreme winds and a few storms that we left it set up on the beach for while we ran for shelter in the car Its small and portable and can be put up by one person with a bit of difficulty and not in high winds It is not at all hard with two even in the high wind if you take the time to fill the included sand bags with sand insert them in the in interior pockets to help weight it down so you dont have a kite on your hands My only regret is that it only accomodates ground sitting or low beach chairs which are hard for me to get out of I prefer my umbrella but when the wind is high I use this for shade AND its a wonderful wind block when you close up the back window This way I can make sandwiches and we arent eating sand in every bite All in all I am most pleased with this purchase There are ones out there that pop up and are taller but not as stable as this one is in the ever present wind that seems to come everytime I am on the beach As I mentioned I left it during a storm once we threw the cooler and chairs inside and closed up both flaps the front you see pictured actually can zip up as well or its a sitting spot and although its not meant to be waterproof it kept the stuff reasonably dry and the stuff helped keep it from blowing away  I would also suggest stronger stakes if you are in high winds the small ones dont really do much but with the sand and my gear its managed to hold ok without them I use this along with my umbrella and I can spend all day on the beach and not burn Hope this helps

What a great cooler 
Quality Durable Kept my food cold over a five day camping trip in California with heat I was impressed how well the ice block ice held up considering the higher temperatures 90s I look forward to more use 
That is what this cooler is like because when you walk into a room or campsite and this cooler is there you just have to look at it Its sooooo darned sexy  OK so we have had ours about seven years or so We bought it when we were still tent camping and now we use it with our popup camper We could not be much happier with any cooler You need to make one improvement as soon as you buy this but its so inexpensive I still have to give this 5 stars Id give it 6 if I could Go to your nearest big box home improvement store and buy a small roll of white adhesive backed 14 X 14 foam gasket by Frost King or similar manufacturer Clean the groove in the lid with a solvent like Mineral spirits or similar Peel the backing off the gasket and stick the gasket into the groove in the lid working your way around to the back where you started Cut the gasket so its essentially one continuous seal leaving as small of a gap between start and finish as possible Now when you close the lid you will have a virtually air tight seal We go camping a week or sometimes eight days at a time Before we leave I go to the grocery store and buy 2 five lb pieces of block ice to put in the bottom If you have the freezer space you could make some block ice at home and save the 4 or 5 bucks After placing the block ice one either side of the bottom of the cooler I add our weeks worth of food bacon dogs burgers bacon milk butter bacon steak bacon you name it  Then on top of the food I add regular ice which I make at home though sometimes we buy it bagged at the store This cooler keeps ice 8 days or more this way no kidding  Im so completely impressed I have left the cooler closed after returning home and had some of the block ice still in it over 9 days Yes I also grew up camping with a 1960s original steel belted Coleman cooler and yes Ill admit the quality of the vintage coolers was better Thicker steel better latch screw on Oringed drain cap and built in bottle opener Believe me I will get that ole Coleman from my big brother one day  It will be mine oh yes it will be mine  But the reality is the new steel belted coolers are what we can go out and buy today and this one is great Get it in stainless steel and it will be guaranteed never to shrink stink wrinkle or rust

Well I missed the one month window for return without knowing and now Im stuck with this defective basin We went camping for Easter and upon first use I noticed that the corners were leaking The water drained out of the corners and we had to was the dishes quickly Its not very sturdy and my 12 pans did not fit all the way I mostly used it to hold the soapy water while I held my dishes and lathered them up I would have been better off buying a plastic tub for the dishes 
Recently had a week on Cape Cod with this shade tent four days on the beach all of them sunny and warm one day very windy Build quality is solid and I expect to have many seasons use out of this tent It is roomy for two adults The large rear window has an insect screen and can be opened for air circulation When fully closed there is enough room for one adult to get changed The windy day exposed a couple of flaws First if its windy youll need better pegs The six pegs provided would be adequate for firm soil but not sand Second Im not sure why but the two guy ropes would not stay tightened even when there was no wind The nylon friction devices slipped far too easily on the cord Ive never had this problem before on any other tent and may need to buy replacements This shade tent was difficult to put up singlehanded I am an experienced camper and over the years have owned a number of tents with the shockcorded pole design All of the others including my current threeperson made by Coleman I couldcan erect unassisted in a few minutes I think the biggest issue with this tent is that the sleeves for the poles are mesh rather than solid material This makes sliding the poles in and out a real hassle the pole joints continuously snag on the mesh so you need an extra pair of hands to help guide them through Overall Im happy with my purchase because once the tent is up it does its job very well and I have no doubts about its quality and longevity

I just bought this bear canister but full disclosure not on Amazon I caught a really good sale elsewhere Memorial day weekend But on to the review I was a backpacker in high school and college and a little beyond But Ive been away from it for a couple of decades Bear canisters didnt exist way back when so Id never used one And I never had a problem with bears in the the White Mountains of NH where I used to hike But I did have plenty of problems with mice around shelters and chipmunks and squirrels and raccoons Annoying little buggers We also have coyotes fox bobcats  lynx the very rare reported cougar sighting and brainless golden retrievers on the trail By far I worry more about rodents than bears So when I got into backpacking again I did a lot of reading to catch up on equipment and clothing trends One thing I found is that many areas and national parks around the country are now requiring some form of bear resistant protection for your food Hmmm never even crossed my mind Apparently black bear populations are doing really well here in the Northeast and human  bear interactions have increased to the point where its not all that unusual to get a visit from a lazy thief looking for snacks So I looked around at bear canisters and quickly narrowed my choices down to two options the Bear Keg and the Bear Vault BV500 I finally chose the Bear Keg Why 1 Size Both are large The Bear Vault is 700 cu in or 1147 liters The Bear keg is just slightly larger at 716 cu in or 1173 liters But call the size a tie Both can handle food for two people for 45 days 2 Access Both have an opening of almost exactly 7 which is fine for getting stuff in or out Again no significant difference 3 Weight Here we get into the biggest difference between the two options The Bear Vault is made from polycarbonate and weighs 25 lbs The Bear Keg is made from some other polymer but they dont state exactly what and it weighs in at a whopping 35 lbs empty So the Bear Vault wins on weight which is a biggie 4 Locks Heres the second big difference The Bear Vault uses a screw on lid with plastic tabs that need to be depressed in order to rotate the lid But people report that depressing those tabs requires a leaning curve And they say that when the plastic is cold it doesnt flex very well Also cold fingers are apparently hard pressed to operate the tabs But most importantly bears in the Adirondacks of NY about two hours from my home have apparently figured out how to use the tabs just fine The Bear Vault has proven to be defeatable by real black bears The Bear Keg on the other hand uses three rotating latches that require some sort of tool to open A coin a key a knife something with a thin straight edge The locks are simple easy to use in any weather and reliable But best of all bears havent figured out how to defeat them as long as you close up the keg properly 5 Color No Im not gonna get into a discussion of trail fashion here The Bear Vault uses clear polycarbonate which provides a really nice side benefityou can see whats in the canister and where it is in the canister This cuts down on digging dumping and repacking But a clear canister can be a lot more difficult to find in the woods What if a bear plays with it for 15 minutes and moves it 100 feet from its original location Clear or black canisters are a lot tougher to see when you dont know where to look The Bear Keg on the other hand uses an opaque day glow yellow polymer that stands out like a sore thumb against a green brown and grey background in the woods It also had a band of reflective material around the middle in case youre searching for it with a headlamp at night The convenience of a clear container does me no good if I cant find the container Also these bear canisters are not so huge that its very difficult to find stuff in them And it gets easier every day as you consume the food in them 6 Price Both the Bear Vault and the Bear Keg have the same list price and both can be found discounted to near the same price online So price is not a discriminating factor 7 Attaching To A Pack The Bear Vault has dimples and ridges molded in for grip These allow it to be cinched to a pack with paracord or a velcro strap The Bear Keg is smooth and slippery all the way around with an oval shape thats fatter at the center than the ends That makes it tougher for a bear to manipulate but it also means its tougher to attach to a pack For that reason They sell a nylon carrying case for the Bear Keg but that increases the cost and drives up the weight even more Not a problem for me my pack is a 110 liter Kelty Red Cloud I carry everything inside my pack Its easier than lashing stuff to the outside If you intend to lash a canister outside your pack the carry case is a must have But DO NOT place the canister at night with the case on The nylon bag provides a bear with a convenient carry handle to cart off your bear keg thereby defeating the whole idea of protecting your food supply So in the end what made me buy the Bear Keg over a lighter alternative were better security easy to use locks and the high visibility color I couldnt find any place in the lower 48 where the Bear Keg is not certified for use On the other hand the Adirondacks near my home wont allow the Bear Vault because bears have learned how to defeat the locks on it I docked the product one star for weight This is one of the heaviest options on the market Id love to see them get the weight down a pound or so without compromising volume or security But maybe thats a tough wish to fulfill PS  Either of these canisters makes a serviceable camp stool for eating lacing up your boots washing dishes or washing clothes Happy trails and be safe out there 
This canister is extremely well made and durable It is also VERY heavy Youll definitely need the carrying case for it or some method to attach it to your pack In retrospect there are other products which will do the same thing and weigh much less 
This is one of the larger canisters out there  and unfortunately one of the heaviest Ive had it for a few years and while its no fun to carry it works Its not waterproof though which means its probably not scentproof either Ive never had it attacked by a bear so I cant speak to its effectiveness I did buy the carrying case which makes it possible to strap it to the bottom of your pack rather than inside if necessary Be sure to remove it from the carrying case when you place it at night or it just gives the bear something to carry it away with

Over a year and a half ago my wifes extended family had a beach trip planned in 2014 This was before my wife was even pregnant Fast forward to a few months ago we were concerned about sun exposure with our daughter who would be 4 months old by the time we would use this tent Our pediatrician gave us 2 guidelines 1 Limit all sun exposure if possible 2 If 1 is not possible then use baby sunscreen but try to not use it until shes 6 months old By those 2 guidelines I started searching all over for some kind of protection on the beach I originally saw thenbspa datahookproductlinklinked classalinknormal hrefSportBrellaUmbrellaPortableSunandWeatherShelterdpB002CLQ1T4refcmcrarpdrvwtxtieUTF8SportBrella Umbrella  Portable Sun and Weather Shelteranbspat a local store They had it set up on display but there were a few things I didnt like about it First it seemed too low on the ground I know that 90 of the time I will be sitting down in it but it just seemed too low when using beach chairs with a fairly tall adult Secondly there is no bottom on it Its open to the ground So whatever you place the SportBrella on you need to lay down some towels tarp or something else unless you want your butt on the ground In my case it would be the sand Lastly I didnt like that the SportBrella didnt have the ability to close Its wideopen design meant that the usage for shade was limited to the sun movement and there was no privacy Meaning when my baby is trying to sleep or if Im changing herchanging my clothes then its wide open for everyone to see So thats when I started looking for alternatives and saw the Coleman Beach Shade After reading a couple reviews and seeing pictures of other buyers who also had babies with it I was sold The tent is plenty big enough Fully assembled with the front flap down  anchored as seen in the picture it can easily accommodate two adults and a baby with plenty of space for a diaper bag cooler etc With front flap up an adult and a baby can easily lay down on their backs with it With the design you get plenty of sun protection via the shade  SPF fabric The ability to open the rear for venting air or even as an exit is a nice touch It doesnt get too hot in there and while on the beach there was a nice breeze flowing through the tent Also I LOVED that it came with both stakes AND sandbags for options to anchor the tent down My only complaint about the tent is that when assembling it can take a little while to put together When trying the first time it can easily take you 20 minutes to put it together It definitely becomes easier if you have a second person Ive assembleddisassembled this tent at least a dozen times now and although I get better at it with each try it still takes time to put together Ive shaved my time down to about 810 minutes With the tent you get 3 poles The 2 shorter black poles run from front to back The long gray pole runs across the two black poles Once the poles are installed you fit each end into a grommet at the base of the tent The problem is that the long gray pole gets caught on the mesh fabric regardless of whether youre assembling or disassembling the tent Part of the reason it gets caught is because the poles can collapse This is part of the reason howwhy the tent can fit in the carry bag When shoving the rod through the mesh or pulling sometimes the pole collapses and you have to fix it This is why its so hard to put the tent together And because of that I dock it one star Overall I love this tent and would gladly recommend it to anyone looking for shade on the beach especially those with babies

I use an ice chest every day and bought it hoping it would do a better job of keeping things cold without giving up storage space I am very pleased Ice stays frozen twice as long The latches work well handles are strong I cant find anything I dont like about it 
I left a shorter review of this cooler earlier but after further use wanted to return to leave a more comprehensive review INTRODUCTION I purchased this cooler on the recommendation of a friend who had several at a tailgate party I attended After searching around for the best price I settled on purchasing the green colored cooler which was the cheapest at the time from Amazon As a prime eligible purchase it arrived two days later in perfect condition Absolutely no dings scratches or dents like other reviews mention It was perfectly packaged in factory boxes APPEARANCE The cooler is plastic encased in steel The colored portion you see is steel whereas the white portion is plastic Some people seem to believe this cooler is all steel It is not It is steel belted as the description clearly states The latch is metal and plastic The handles are also metal but with plastic grips The coolers appearance is stylish Also there is NO bottle opener on this version of the cooler Some reviews allude to the presence of a bottle opener on the outside of the cooler There is certainly not one on the version I ordered FUNCTIONALITY AND USE Hands down this is the best cooler I have ever owned I take a lot of road trips and travel a lot for work and used to carry along an old generic plastic cooler with me to keep snacks water and soda This cooler has replaced my old beat up travel buddy It fits nicely in the back of my Ford Escape and has more then enough storage space for meats cheese bread yogurt fruit beer and ice I can stock it with enough food for a 35 day trip easily The cooler keeps ice for about two to three days outside of extreme temperatures Two or three two liter bottles of ice are enough to keep everything cold for at least 2 says If necessary the ice can be supplemented with a bag of two from the motel to get you through the last day or two of your trip I do not use the chemical ice packs except one small one see below but they might last a little longer Now just one thing to consider before you purchase this item The cooler can get heavy especially when fully loaded Of course it depends on what you put in the cooler but I have loaded mine up to what was probably more then fifty pounds That can be a lot of weight to carry especially longer distances Unless you are a large burly man dont plan on carry this cooler fully loaded around all day long The plastic grips do a good job of stopping the handles from cutting into your hands when carrying and it is on the heavy side To get around this limitation I keep a small cold pack in the cooler and a small insulated bag I got as a freebie at a convention Whenever I need to take something from the car to a different location and do not want to lug the entire cooler I just place what I need in the insulated bag with the cold pack TIPS 1 Dont waste your money buying bagged ice at convenience stores Fill recycled two liter bottles 34 way full of water and freeze them Use these bottles as ice packs It will not only save you the mess of melted ice but also a few dollars because you wont have to buy ice 2 Make sure to chill everything that will go in the cooler at least overnight This will help extend the life of the ice in the cooler 3 It is useful to keep something like a bottle opener or cork screw in your cooler Even a small folding knife can be a lifesaver when you need to cut open a package or some food CONCLUSION This cooler is well worth the money Yes you can find cheaper alternatives in stores and online But the value of this cooler cannot be surpassed You may save a few dollars by buying a generic plastic cooler but those savings will quickly be lost with all your ice purchases and loss of food due to heat 
Its frustrating to figure out how to repack flat 
small dishes only 
I mostly burst into flames at the beach so when my girlfriend suggested we get something like this for the upcoming family beach day I was relieved and immediately ordered it from Amazon It arrived on time as usual and we did a dry run in the back yard I figured that was better than breaking up in front of her family at the beach if it were really hard to put together One pass over the instructions  which are cleverly attached to the case so they cant be lost  and I was on my way It probably too me ten minutes the first time but it wasnt that difficult at all The most difficult part was putting it back in the case But we all know that these things never go back in there the way they were Beach day came a couple of days later and it was time for the true test I was worried about the stakes not staying in the beach sand but they performed fine It was a little tougher to assemble on the beach than it had been in the back yard due to the wind and sand but I had experience on my side and it was up in no time We convinced the kids that filling the included sand bags was a game so that pretty much took care of itself I did end up spilling one of the sand bags inside of the shade I wish the drawstrings had some kind of tension closure I think next time Ill bring Ziploc bags to put inside of the sandbags Or I could just be more careful There were other variants of this nearby on the beach so I got to watch their experience They mostly went up faster but seemed to not store as compactly They also either did not offer as much coverage or didnt have the complete zip up feature like the Coleman did I ended up changing inside of this one which was a neat feature The kids enjoyed getting inside and zipping it up also Though out in the sun it got very hot very quickly with the zipper closed I can see how the wind could be an issue but if you open the back window it seems to pass through Overall the shade was awesome and just what I needed Almost everyone ended up in it at some point One of the kids took a nap in it when the others werent using it as a beach fort My girlfriend took a nap in it I spent much of my time avoiding spontaneous combustion in there It did fill up with sand pretty easily but its the beach what are ya gonna do I have four improvements that it could use 1 Two more stakes to hold the front flap down  Ill probably end up buying some because i didnt like that it was just loose 2 The lack of side windows made it a little isolating when inside the shade 3 The guides for the poles are mesh which makes them hard to thread the poles through though I can see some benefit of mesh 4 Sandbags that seal better All of these are minor and this is an awesome product

When Coleman designed this cooler they left off a way to stop the lid from opening past 90ish degrees This results in the lid opening about 180 degrees which stresses the hinges and breaks the outer stainless layer away from the inner insulation I have been through two lids and now the body of the cooler is breaking away the same way Yes it does have a 100 year warranty but I bought expecting the same build quality as my grandfathers that is 60 years old There is just no comparison Coleman also says it will keep ice for 3 days at 100 degrees This couldnt be further from the truth It will not hold ice for 24 hours at 85 degrees Bottom line Buy a good Igloo marine cooler and use the extra 70 to fill it with your beverage of choice

When we finally moved into a house with a backyard larger than a postage stamp we wanted a simple way to take advantage of it on a nice summer day Bocce ball is very much like shuffleboard or bowling some people take it way too seriously but for the rest of us its a fun and easy game to play with a group of nonpros The balls are heavy and resilient We have had them bash together from some overlyaggressive tosses and none of them have cracked or chipped The measuring string is a bit cheap but it works perfectly fine for the tooclosetotell shots and has little knots to make measuring easier The case is strong enough to lug the set around it and includes a divider to keep the bottom layer and top layer from banging against each other or shifting around in the bag All in all I have zero complaints with this set and it has served us well even on our outofregulation backyard

Here is a good sturdy medium strength shovel for just about any purpose you can have whether camping hiking for the car gardening etc This is the kind of personal shovel that is issued to military personnel It folds into a trinagle about 6Lx4Wx2H and when extended is about 10 long It has a ripple on one edge that is supposed to represent a saw built onto the blade This shovel is very good for chipping ice in the winter time when you get your vehicle stuck It is somewhat adequate for shoveling snow it gets the job done but that is not what it was designed for Have two vehicles and have one of these shovels in each Great for when you get stuck in any other type of soilterrain other than snow It is great for gardening camping and hiking If your are in a combat situation this shovel is great for digging that hasty fighting postion its intended purpose and then improve that position with a larger shovel This shovel also is great if you got to do the poo thing because you can dig a hole and fold the blade to a 90 degree position lock it in place set the handle on the ground with the 90 degree shovel standing up and sit on it to use as a seat Unfortunately you can only place one butt cheek on the blade that is all the room you have for It also makes for a good sturdy weapon against critters and such when extended It comes with a plastic container that attaches to your utility belt or backpack The uses for this shovel are only limited to your imagination The only thing that I can really say bad about this shovel is that makebelieve saw on one of the blades It is worthless and is a big joke Twenty years in the military using a shovel like this and not once was I able to saw through anything Guess it makes a good conversation piece around the camp fire 
Ive been wilderness camping for over 26 years When I first started as a Boy Scout a folding shovel was high on my list of must have camping gear After purchasing one however and carrying it with me on a number of outings I soon came to a different conclusion Why do most people want to carry a shovel I usually hear three reasons 1 to dig a trench around a tent 2 to shovel ash out of the fire pit and 3 to dig a scat hole a hole for depositing excrement Let me address those three items and then address some different types of camping or outings that may further influence your decision TRENCHING AROUND TENTS  Simply put this is an outdated practice that causes erosion in campsites Trenches eventually fill and overflow carrying off soil and altering the conditions in the site In fact most campsites and all National Parks and wilderness areas prohibit trenching If you really want the floor of your tent to stay dry on the inside purchase a tent with a tub floor where the seams are raised off the bottom of the tend and a good rain fly SHOVELING ASH  While a shovel can be used to shovel ash out of a fire pit so can small gargen trowel a metal cup a metal plate or even a frying pan Youre likely already going to be carrying a cup plate or pan so there is no need to carry the extra gear the shovel A large stick can be used to stir coals in an active fire and the cookware can be rinsed with water after using it to dig out the fire pit SCAT HOLES  When digging a hole for human waste you typically need to turn only a few inches of soil Ive found that a garden trowel does a splendid job and it weighs only a few ounces compared to the 24 lbs of this shovel DIFFERNT CAMPING METHODS REQUIRE DIFFERENT GEAR  Lets face it it makes a difference if you are driving into a campsite rather than hiking in If driving in you are less concerned about how heavy your gear is so a shovel like this one may be a nice luxury If backpacking or on any wilderness excursion where you are carrying everything you need you feel every extra ounce you carry In such cases a gardening trowel makes more sense You can get one made from composite plastics that is very hard and durable but weighs only a few ounces In my years of experience I found that the weight of the shovel was not worth the benefit I received from it while on wilderness treks However I love keeping one of these in the trunk of my car to help dig out if I get stuck in the snow The Coleman folding shovel is a nice little tool You just need to decide if you want to carry it with you when you spend time in the wilderness 
I took a camping trip last year and encountered a fire pit where the previous tenants didnt remove their ash waste and I was forced to waste nearly an hour cleaning it out I vowed I would never go through that again I went on a search for a armylike folding shovel without the cost as I would only be using it to clean fire pits upon arrival and departure However I also needed something that was easy to pack away as I drive a sportwagon style vehicle This shovel is perfect in nearly all ways I say nearly because no product is perfect and there will be some flaw that I dwell on its a bit difficult to fold initially but you get the hang of it that someone else wont It fits perfectly in my vehicles rear storage compartment tucked above the wheelwell It feels sturdy as if it was made with good materials and I can say that it will survive many a camping trip in the future This shovel is not meant to dig foxholes or trenches it just wasnt built with that in mind It was meant for simple to moderate tasks and if I could improve on one thing that isnt the folding it would be to add a pick to it as it could then be used to help drive stakes for tents Otherwise it is a good buy compare its cost to the big box retailers 
I wanted to dig a small hole for less than 10 dollars This shovel enabled me to dig a small hole for less than 10 dollars If you would like to dig a small hole for less than 10 dollars then you should buy this shovel

I was looking for a folding shovel to include in a Roadside Emergency Kit for the trunk of my family car I made the decision to buy this shovel in spite of the negative reviews since I have never bought a Coleman product in the past that I was truly dissatisfied with Well as they say there is a first time for everything This shovel is made in Taiwan and it lives up to everything you have ever heard about products from that region of the world At first glance the shovel looks and feels like it is quality that is until you actually begin to use it I was shocked when I opened the shovel for the first time and screwed the locked up against the shovel as tightly as I could without the help of a wrench and even double and triple checked the lock to make sure it was seated correctly etc and then holding the shovel in my hands I attempted to override the lock and pull the shovel toward me out of the full open position into the hoe or chopping position and I was surprised at how easily the shovel just folded over with very little effort on my part I am 66 years old and have arthritis in both hands so that should give you some idea of how easily it folded I also noticed that the three sections of the shovel wiggle at least 14 back and forth even when securely locked open I have not attempted to actually dig with the shovel since I am afraid that doing so will cause the three sections to fold up during use and I could end up with injuries TOTALLY DISAPPOINTED RETURNING THE PRODUCT FOR REFUND DO NOT RECOMMEND AT ALL ESPECIALLY FOR USE IN AN EMERGENCY The last thing I need is to be injured by a tool I bought to help me get out of a lifethreatening emergency The irony of that possibility is more than I am willing to deal with

materials feel better than most Bottom line the game of Bocce is tons of fun and this set is the best Ive played with I have had many times where more than four people want to play Usually it is more I bought this set for my fatherinlaw and got a chance to play over the July 4th weekend The balls have a good heft to them not light like some others Ive used and the bag is fine I think another reviewer stated there were no instructions At least in this shipment there was a singlesided 85x11 page of instructions at the top of the bag Because they are made of resin I noticed some marks and scratches on the balls before the first round was even over but they didnt affect gameplay roll bounce etc One minor gripe is that the set has four colors instead of two but thats easily overlooked when having a blast playing bocce with friends and family Im going to order a set for myself once Im done with this review I want to use these on grass the beach anywhere

I have been using Orange Bilge Cleaner for decades and this Star Brite does a really nice job I have an 18 foot Classic Donzi and it sprang an oil leak right at the oil leak detector device So I wound up with some oil in my bilge Thank goodness I noticed it in time Anyhow regular soaps dont seem to cut it for really getting out the grease This orange bilge cleaner not only gets out the oil with a minimum of scrubbing in the areas that are accessible and can be seen it also passively helps to reduce the amounts that get into the nonvisible areas under the deck The real thing is the citrus orange smell Makes you want to use it even when the bilge is already clean A little bit goes a long way Highly recommended 
Im using this as a general purpose greasy parts cleaner in my workshop and it is great for that 
This orange cleaner does a good job of cleaning greasy grime as well as organic matter and leaves a pleasant orange fragrance It is very similar or identical to other products from the same brand that are labelled for other uses as well as other brands of orange cleaners on the market It is available in larger sizes so definitely shop around for the best value Be careful not to allow this or other marine cleaners to pollute the water

This is an updated review of the product as of 06132017 The boat I most recently used this on is a 2007 Correct Craft 22 Super Air Nautigue My boat typically is clean as I spray the hold on a normal wash There are extra brass fittings in the boat for water shutoffs for ballast tanks so it is a busy area I only use this boat in fresh water With that said I used the recommended mix poured the solution into the hold and let it sit for 30 minutes I was not comfortable opening the bilge out for the entire pumpout because of the environment in where the trailer was parked so after allthree bilge pumps were in fact pumping for 5 minutes I shut the pumps off I did notice the same color coming from the outlets from the sides of the boat so I figured it cleaned the hoses and pumps After visual inspection in the hold there was no visual residue or leftover product on the fittings but I did still wash over the affected area with a garden hose This is a nice product I will share information with fellow boat enthusiasts about the product and my findings 
Were new to boating but I have been happy to try out a whole series of Star brite cleaners and liquids This one does just what it says it does and we have been able to use it on fiberglass metal and plastic The fresh orange scent is a relief and a pleasure too Citrus extract formula emulsifies oil grease fuel and transmission fluid Powerful yet biodegradable formula Will not harm fiberglass metal plastic Leaves a fresh citrus smell in bilge 
One bottle does a boat up to a 25 foot boat If the bilge is dry you need to add some water  I used a 5 gallon bucket and added this to the bucket then dumped in Cleaning out the bilge is the biggest pain  you obviously dont want to just pump the waste into the lake I used a wetvac Did a great job cleaning and left the bilge smelling like a fruit stand BTW Ive also used this in my ejection pump well at home  occasionally the pump gets jammed or the float switch breaks I dump in about 13rd of a bottle in the sump and let it sit a while then pull the pump Cuts down on the grime and stink

I purchased this for our beach vacation upon arrival I put it together inside and assembly was easy It becomes slightly more difficult with wind at the beach but the tent is well made and makes a great sun shelter and even light rain shelter I understand the concern about the mesh that holds the poles but I have not had an issue with it Its difficult to push the poles through fast because the connectors catch on the fabric thus you have to feed them through slowly anyway making it easy to be careful not to thrust it through the fabric All 3 fiberglass pole pieces feed through these very long mesh loops I like the mesh better than a solid loops because it allows sand and water to pass through instead of sitting inside causing damage Overall its a great tent and you just have to treat it well

Was so glad to find a more affordable option compared to the Kelty As we live 15 hours or more from the closest saltwater beach when we go we stay all day After setting this up folks who were leaving stated that if they had a shelter like us they wouldnt be leaving The temp was in the high 90s with nary a cloud in sight A great day to test out our shelter Prior to purchasing this we used two beach umbrellas and would need to move with the shade all day  but if youre on a real crowded beach and your neighbors are real close you have to move your umbrellas all day Either way its annoying inconvenient and can be downright dangerous if youve fallen asleep This eliminates almost all of that I say almost as we still needed an umbrella in front until later in the afternoon when the sun was mostly behind us We enjoyed the partial privacy afforded by blocking our view of our side neighbors It was very nice to take a nap and not worry about the sun moving OR feeling as though youre on display while you sleep We only used stakes around the edges of the shelter we didnt feel we would need tieout lines At times the wind was extremely gusty and although we didnt use the tieout lines the shelter didnt go anywhere  many beach umbrellas became projectiles and our own umbrella turned inside out  so the wind was very strong We also liked having items in the shelter that were kept sandfree It was nice to have everything contained within the shelter And if youre like us and like to go for long walks its nice to know that your stuff isnt exposed to everyone and the sea gulls We had the back window open and rolled up for ventilation until the sun moved back there Then we unhooked it and let it hang so wed be shaded but still have ventilation We are more than pleased with this shelter Its easy to set up roomy stays put in gusty winds is easy to take down and doesnt weigh much We are looking forward to our next beach day

The Coleman Road Trip Beach Shade saved our trip to the beach Went to barrier islands of SC second week of March It was cold and windy The beach shade angled just right protected us from the chilly breeze It stood up against strong wind gusts and stayed firmly anchored Of course it protected us from the sun as well I am very pleased with the Coleman Beach Shade 
I was hesitant to purchase this based upon some of the complaints but having assembled this today in the house I do not foresee any quality problems or other issues and expect this tent will last for years to come Assembly is just like a normal tent with fiberglass rods that assemble into a longer pole There are three poles each about 6 to 8 feet long assembled The poles slide into mesh sleeves which are less durable than nylon fabric but prevent sand from filling the sleeves Just take your time during tent assembly and disassembly do not force the rods and the mesh should not be a problem As for the tent itself it is quite large easily fitting two adults possible three In the back is a doorwindow with a solid panel and screen depending upon which zipper you open there are two on the back door one for the nylon flap one for the screen The large front door also zips shut for privacychanging clothes The carry case is also nice and well made with handles to carry everything in a compact form This tent is a really great item and I will update this review should there be any issues which I do not foresee given the nice quality of this tent The tent is made in Bangladesh UPDATE MAY 5 2013 We took this to the beach where the conditions were windy Set up required two adults to fight against the wind Total set up time must have been 10 minutes however once set up it provided shelter from the wind and sun We stayed all day at the beach until almost sunset and without the tent the wind and sun would have forced us to leave much sooner Some strong gusts did occasionally push the tent sides in a bit but they popped back out as the wind subsided On windy days I would not leave the tent without a person inside to prevent it blowing away The included sand bags which we used would not have prevented the tent from blowing away Taking the tent down was much easier taking about 2 minutes My review above still stands but I wanted to update with how it performs on a windy day

This product is very simple to use Just put it in the tank of your Coleman liquid fuel product and press down on the spout Wait for it to stop gurgling and then your tank is full It would be difficult to use if you were also using a filtering funnel since you need to press down on the spout for fuel to come out I would suggest you dont use this product in conjunction with a filter funnel

Have used these for years and will never go back to using a funnel Almost drip proof and unspillable  but do release the pressure in hot weather before filling A lot cheaper online Good product 
This is a musthave item if you use Coleman fuel for your gas stoves and lantern I dont know why I waited so long to get one You replace the white cap on the fuel can standard 1 diameter by putting this threaded filler device in place of the cap Put the nozzle into the fuel canister of your stove or lantern and push down which releases the liquid fuel from the fuel can into your stove or lantern You can hear the fuel going into the stove or lantern glug glug glug When the sound stops it is full You just life the filler assembly out of the stovelantern and you are done The stovelantern will be filled to the exact correct level and not overfilled If you have ever filled a Coleman liquid fuel stove or lantern using a funnel or directly filling it without a funnel then you know that overfilling or underfilling and spilling is very common and difficult to avoid This device solves the fill level and spilling problems when filling Coleman liquid fuel stoves and lanterns

I like the conceptdispensing fuel directly from the cumbersome Coleman cans directly into the appliance and an automatic shutoff when the tank is full Unfortunately the one I purchased years ago leaked from day 1 It got to the point that the amount of fuel I spilledlost while using this was the same as the fuel I spilled when pouring directly from the can into a funnel Pros  Pour directly from those ridiculously difficulttouse Coleman fuel cans  Leave it installed on the can all the time  Fit directly into the spout of Coleman appliances  Automatically stops flowing when the appliance fuel tank is full Cons  Mine leaked quite a bit even from new Perhaps I got a defective unit Consider finding a way to keep the internal gasketsorings lubricated Maybe that would cut down on leakage  With the weight of full fuel can its easy to torque the twopiece design which causes fuel to leak at the internal seal  I still lost a bit of fuel while filling appliance much less than pouring directly from a can but enough to be annoying nonetheless  No filter as far as I can tell Thats not a problem if Im using brand new fresh fuel but if Im using older fuel which could have contaminants or gelled globs I could end up with a clogged appliance I think Ill try purchasing another one to see if its better than the first leaky one I used Edit I purchased a second one and I dont currently have any problems with leaking 1 star added
