I bought this filler after reading other online reviews and thinking that the Coleman stove and lamp I ordered at the same time didnt have funnels I now have two funnels and one fuel filler I havent even bothered opening the funnels as this fuel filler is light years ahead in convenience Once you attach the filler to the top of the fuel can you simply invert the can into the receptacle and nothing comes out until your ready to push the fuel filler in While tent camping in 37 degree weather refilling my cooking stove with frozen hands was extremely easy and didnt make me worry about spilling the fuel all over the stove and table The convenience makes it worth every cent 
This device works as designed though Id rather it cost five bucks instead Upside no spillage Downside no filter can be harder to judge fill level by ear since the entire filler hole is covered and the gurgling is muffled 
This is a simple ingenious product that makes filling lanterns effortless You wont spill a drop of fuel in the filling process Screw this fuel filler on the fuel can it works on the small weekender bottles too tip into the lantern or other fuel product press down slightly and it fills up It will stop when it has reached a safe capacity Brilliant safe and cheap 
I hope my experience was just an anomaly but I was very disappointed with the quality of sewing and strength of materials used in the supports  The anchors are very light gauge and bend very easily when hammering them in The stitching at the securing points were poorly done and missed at the end causing the tent not to lay flat and the post to slip out The support bars dont lock together making it impossible to pull the bars through When the bars come undone they can split easily making the entire structure lop sided The material is very thin and does not radiate heat as well as other previously owned tents Folding the canopy neatly is next to impossible Looks good when its up and design is well thought out even though poor executed 
We have owned this tent for a month or so and we have used it 6 or so times already We had bought it so that my 6 month old wouldnt get too much sun when we are at the beach Ill start off by telling you the features that we like about it  It produces a good amount of shade  Its nice looking  It could double as a camping tent for a child or small adult without gear in a pinch  It has a floor that extends out passed the canopy  If set up correctly it is rock solid against even moderate wind We have not been out in a storm or really heavy winds but you probably wouldnt want to be at the beach bad weather anyway  The back flap can be tied open zipped to a mosquito net or zipped with a nylon flap Very versitile  It packs away in a nice small light package The only thing that I dont like about it is that they used a netted material to make the sleeves that the poles slide through I understand why they chose it and dont really know if there would have been a better material to use They used it so that it doesnt get full of sand and for it to dry very if wet However 90 of the time assembling it you will spend it dealing with the couplings and ends of the poles getting gigged on the netted material If your not careful I can see how it would tear quite easily You have to be patient and take your time sliding it through while helping releasing the snags as they present themselves cause they will It seems as if the slower you try to do it the faster and easier it will go Even with one person Isnt that the case with most things though I like the sandbags If you fill them up all the way and burry them in the sand the tent will be rock solid The stakes are pretty thin and will not work in the sand obviously They dont seem like they will take much hammering unless its really soft dirt Try attaching the filled sand bags before setting it up so you wont have to fight the wind Then move it where you like it and then burry the sandbags to really anchor it down Thats how I do it and it works great Once up you will love it So stop reading any more reviews and buy it already  
Bought this table for camping but use it for parties and gettogethers at home as well Love it due to its easy transportability Folds up and sets up quickly unlike those cumbersome folding card tables Highly recommend for the value 
Pros lots of sun shelter great place for my infant to nap in fun for preschoolers to run around packs up nicely not too difficult to set up Cons sand gets trapped in the poles makes it hard to snap into place sand causes poles to crack replacement kits are available but for a price tends to want to fly in the wind but if you anchor it right and pay attention its not a huge deal bottom line is we enjoyed the tent on the beach and didnt find it hard to set up though its a bit of a chore but the poles break too easily considering it was used as directed at a beach 
I heard some people say that the sleeves for the poles were easily ripped and it made me think twice about buying it Upon receiving the tent and really checking it out I see no problem with the sleeves I think if you were to carelessly shove the poles through then yes they could rip but anyone who is familiar with tent setups will take their time and ensure that this wont happen I would recommend this product to friends any day  Great for anyone with kids and the material has I believe an SPF rating over 50  
It is light enough and sturdy enough to make it very convenient to take it on the road for camping Sure it is not the srongest table in the world but strong enough to satisfy me 
For quick set up in home for puzzles family gatherings etc it is perfect Support for the table is on both ends The middle is supported by the middle hinge which will sag and may fail if a lot of weight is put on the table I made a wooden leg for the center to slip under the table after setting it up and it is sturdy with this setup My leg is 34x1 and has a 1 12 foot glued on The top has a 316 slot to catch the lip of the hinge under the table Without the leg I would only trust the table with things such as chips If you want a heavy duty table this is not for you I like mine for what I bought it for Busy Bee 
great little tent especially for little ones keeps the sun and wind off of you I bought it to help with studying at the beach and it works really well to cut the wind and give some breaks from the sun 


Was not disappointed with this product purchase Great value PrePurchase Selling points when compared to competitive products  UVF rating  Full floor  Front and rear zipable doors  Relative price PostPurchase Selling points  weight  size  Ease of setupeven for noncampers Areas of Improvement  Floor fabric could be thicker perception of frailty causes suspicion of whether or not you would want to place chairs inside  Pole pockets are made out of mesh rather than some competitive products that have fully enclosed pole sleeves This increases the difficulty of setup and in my estimation will be the first area of the tent where we will see wear  tear The mesh easily catches on the flex points of the poles when trying to slide in especially on the long side to side unipole 
I bought this beach shade toof courseuse on the beach I have an 8 month old and he needed shade I thought this looked super cooland it wasafter fighting with it in the 90 degree heat on a sandy beach as the baby screamed and cried It took 15 minutes to set up which doesnt seem like a long time but trust me when I say it was an eternity under the circumstances So15min to put up woudnt really prevent me from using it again because it was pretty near perfect once assembled The teardown on the other hand was a trainwreck Sure it came down in like 5 minutes but the bag it comes in is much too small for the shade to EVER fit back into The poles alone take up about half the space and unless you have serious origami skills infinite patience no wind no sand no water no crying infant you have no hope Im not sure why theyd make a carrying case thats about the size of a handbag but they sure did Overall its just OK in my book 
In short this bag is heavy but thats the cost of a bag rated at 0 degrees You can find lighter 0 degree bags but you will certainly pay more for them On the other hand because the bag is so thick I dont use a sleeping pad so it washes out for me I just used this bag for a winter camping trip it got to the low 20s maybe high teens and I generally felt comfortable No issues with the zipper snagging either which was great Finally the bag rolls up large in the provided sack so I recommend getting a compress bag You can get it down to at least 23s of the size with that method Ive ordered two of these and would recommend them to anyone looking for a good quality bag in this price range

Used this for our beach trip this summer  we have an 8 month old and I wanted her to have shade and a place to store our belongings while we were in the water Setup was a snap about 5 minutes and the tent was the perfect size for us I put our bags inside and towels down for the baby to roll around on I will say that if you dont open the vent in the back it does get very hot At certain times of day opening the back flap let the sun in but it was essential to get a breeze through there so the baby didnt overheat We only used the stakes 1 day it was really windy the rest of the time we used the sand pockets and it was very secure especially with our bags and towels inside Its too low to actually sit inside  we sat right our chairs on the outside of the tent in the shade and it worked great I bought one for my mother and her fiance as well hes 62 and they both fit comfortably in regular folding chairs Putting it away was pretty easy as well we folded the tent rolled it up tied it and shoved it back in the bag My mother spent a lot of time making it look nice and neat but it does not affect setup and frankly Im too lazy  If you have little ones or plan to be outside and need some shade I highly recommend this tent The baby spent most of her time in there and it was a lifesaver  she didnt get burned at all and had a safe place to play Its great for the beach the park soccer games etc  anywhere you want to set up and have some shade 
Great beach shelter My grandson got in it and had a blast With the window in the back it provides for nice flow through ventilation It was easy to set up although you have to be careful with the shock corded poles you can poke someones eye out with that thing comes to mind Disassembly is just as easy but the barrel connectors could be rounded on the edges to make removal a bit easier When closing the shelter up make sure that the door or window is open about a foot or so otherwise it will be difficult to get the air out of it to fold it up I didnt use the stakes we had enough gear that we stowed inside to keep the shelter in place during a NorEaster The shelter overall is well built With proper care and maintenance it should last for quite a while I would suggest that anytime it is used near a saltwater environment that it be rinsed with fresh water and allowed to dry completely before stowage

Frist let me say they came on time Good packaging I bought these to replace the original ones on a new bike They shift very good and improved the Bike as far as Im concerned Directions make them an easy install 
These shifters came on my Trek 4500 MTB They worked great and never got out of adjustment for a year and a half Then one day the right shifter broke and I was unable to shift into higher gears without forcing the shifter into my handgrip I opened them up to see if I could fix it by pure luck but when a metal piece that had broken off fell out of the case as I opened it I figured it was not fixable I did some quick forum searching and gathered that many Shimano shifters are non rebuildable so if you want a cheap disposable shifter that works well this one fits the bill I gave it 4 stars cause its pretty good for a lower end shifter It didnt get 5 cause it broke in under 2 years My riding consists of weekend rides on fireroads with the family some light commuting when the weather is bad and I dont want to ride my motorcycle in the rain and a very rare 10 mile single track loop near the home I am near the coast and my bike does have rust on many of the screws so that could have attributed to the premature breakdown

Got mine in front of the door yesterday and tore the packaging open like a mad dog This is the 1st polypropylene Cold Steel product Ive ever owned so I was quite surprised  impressed on how sturdy it was being made out of hard plastic yet it gave a bit of flex but in the end retained its shape My mind wondered off today and it slid outta my hands and created a small dent in the wall lol good thing no one else was in the room  First thing I noticed out the box was the Tsuba and the Tsuba Ring not sure of the technical term for the rubber ring came in a separate plastic pouch with clear instructions and pictures for assembly Just note that itll take some muscles to assemble the Tsuba onto the bokken I left mine off for storage purposes  Gave it a few nice hard whacks during the day today  it didnt deform at all until due to my retardedness it slipped out of my hands and flew into a wall Gave my wall a nice little dent and had a bit of plastic curve over on the tip like how the edge of a knife curves due to use not really noticeable but its visible under close inspection Also unlike a wooden bokken when it breaks it wont splinter  Havent gotten to really putting it under a ton of use and pressure but for the price of 2080 at least thats the price of my purchase its totally worth the cash Totally recommend this product to anyone looking for a quality bokken for either their training or just as a decorative piece for the wall  UPDATE March 6th 2015 Ive put the tsuba and the rubber ring that holds it in place on the bokken a day or two ago just to try out how that felt Today just got back from work thought Id play with it a bit took it out and found out the Tsuba Ring broke on me If I had to describe how it broke Id say it was more like someone took a knife and cut it down one side the break is clean  smooth Although I dont know how it broke the Tsuba is currently useless to me The bokken still holds EXTREMELY well so my rating will stay 5 stars Kenny

Great bag Not for your ultra light snobs it will pack down small enough to fit inside of a mountaineering pack if a compression sack is used Its a 5 pounder so dont expect to carry it on your trip across the country As far as temperature ratings goeach human has different temperature regulation and or metabolic make up weight body fat how efficient we burn our caloriesetc That being said  A zero degree sleeping bag for a skinny person with circulation problems is most likely going to get a miserable nights sleep while in below freezing temperatures  but this sleeping bag for a normal healthy person properly outfitted will most likely keep them comfortable in temperatures well below freezing Im comparing this sleeping bag to my good old Northface Bigfoot 5F synthetic sleeping bag that I have had for many yearsand I have to say based on loft weight and design I see no reason why this sleeping bag wouldnt keep you warm and protected from hypothermia in winter conditions Im not talking Mt Everest here But for your 4 season camping adventurer I think with the proper tent and gear it would work just fine I cannot believe the price to quality on this thing

I have heard the temperature ratings of sleeping bags are often misleading and I think I agree for this bag First I always run cold and wear wool socks year round so take that as you will Last year I used this bag in PA with snow on the ground probably between 1020F outside I was cold but my feet were frozen I had to keep a fire going to keep my feet warm which were not in the bag because I could not sleep  When I was on MD on the AT this past March nighttime temp about 3040F I was more comfortable Slept through the night The stuff sack is adequate but does not compact the bag enough for me I use a smaller bags sack like the one my Coleman palmetto came with or a compression stuff sack from Sea to Summit Overall I like the bag a lot the double closure system one around your face and one around your shoulders is great to regulate air a bit between your torso and head or isolate it My only complaint is that there is a more honest temperature rating system in place

I just got two of them today and have been sparring with them all day But I feel Im ready to write a review on it so here we go Durability is not an issue with these bokken At first I thought it may be but they can take some pretty heavy usage as long as you dont beat down a metal post with it Me and my wife have been smacking these around about as much as you would in a tournament and they are barely even scuffed The only removable part would be the handguard or tsuba but this is Murica so Im gonna use English The handguard is pretty tough to slip into its place but not impossible The Oring keeps it on really well too ALMOST no slippage although after a couple of bouts it does come out of place a very little bit The grip is really comfortable HOWEVER when your hands start sweating it does get a little slippery but I would recommend gloves and other safety gear anyway so no complaint here It also weighs and handles really closely to my katana and it has the proper amount of flexibility as a sword should If you were to get struck by this in training there wouldnt be as much damage done as a wooden bokken although you will feel it for sure especially the fingers but thats what gloves are for As a whole Im really glad I bought these They simulate actual combat very well and are very sturdy I recommend these to anybody studying Japanese martial arts

Ive been using my Cold Steel Bokken for over three years now sparring with friends and breaking sticks and its still in great condition PROS  very durable will easily outlast 10 wooden bokken will not rot or break  performs well as a blunt defensive weapon  at a low cost and virtually zero maintenance this thing is fun exercise CONS  may warp if left under stress proper storage is key to prevent warping I recommend using a sword rack or the corner of a room to rest it vertically  the handle is lightly textured but sweaty hands may lose grip I recommend using gloves or wrapping your handle with grip tape This product deserves 55 stars 
As a student and instructor of Kenjutsu and Wakizashijutsu I have had the pleasure of using numerous types of training models both wood and plastic This Cold Steel Bokken is one of the best on the market for the price I found it to be well balanced and durable The weight feels close to the same as with a real Katana and Wakizashi I have used this model for many years while teaching my Kenjutsu and Wakizashijutsu classes in the past and found them to be excellent training weapons If you are serious about training in the Japanese sword arts you cannot go wrong purchasing this Cold Steel sword model Rating 5 Stars Joseph J Truncale Author WakizashiJutsu Official manual for Bushi Satori Ryu

Product used 0 to 3 C early winter in Nepal for trek Coming from Singapore hot weather with young kids travelling with us we needed something to keep VERY warm Its freezing cold and we used it with sweaters woolen socks and sometimes even gloves on Kept us warm much better than normal sleeping bags also bought in Amazon We also got Teton XXL sleeping bag for this trip I was totally shocked of its bulkiness May be great for camps when you travel with own vehicle For 4 of us we took 2 normal sleeping bags 1 coleman and 1 teton XXL and I must say Coleman Sleeping bag size would be almost equal to those 2 normal sleeping bags And slightly bigger than Teton XXL 3 Stars for its bulkiness and not suitable for a trek wo porter But kept warm much better 
I used this sleeping bag for a camping trip to Yosemite National Park during the beginning of November Temperatures at night dipped just below freezing This bag is rated at 0 degrees This doesnt mean youll be cozy and warm in 0 degree weather but that youll be warm enough to stay alive As a person who thinks it is cold when its 65 degrees out I still felt a little cold in this sleeping bag but I was less cold than previous trips in my old sleeping bag Overall this sleeping bag feels well made and durable The zipper closure was strong and didnt snag on the bag It should last many years of use It was not hard to stuff back into stuff sack Not easy not hard but doable with some effort I did not roll it I simply stuffed it back in Others have mentioned that they had difficulty with it but I had no problem with it as an average strength woman 
I practice Kenjutsu and Battojutsu this bokken kodashi or tanto from coldsteel are the real deal light strong and flexible I know that only a few out there are going to understand this but it really cuts I have cut through plastic wood and by accident I made a cut to kote in a practice So if you practice hard its great also I have some students that are begginers they also love this because when they hit wrong it doesnt get broken like wood ones will do Buy them theyre great 
I was going to buy a wooden bokken as a practice sword but I noticed this Cold Steel Bokken was only a little bit more  Im very glad I spent the extra cash The sword is constructed of a very strong polycarbonate plastic that is very tough You could spar with this sword and it will last a very long time even if you are very aggressive I took a few whacks with it at various things and there isnt a single dent on it The only downside to this sword is the very slight flex when hitting something compared to a wooden sword The flex will be unnoticeable unless you are focusing on it and you will not notice it if you are engaged For people purchasing this sword for personal nonprofessional or nonsporting use I just want to warn you how dangerous even this plastic sword is There are videos on youtube where people use this sword to easily crush watermelons and break wooden crates Also make sure you know the laws in your state or country if outside the US regarding carrying these publicly in some states it isnt legal to carry one of these outside even in plain sight You could be arrested Finally I would like to add that I will most likely be keeping this sword but I will also purchase an O Bokken which is only a few inches larger but it is over 50 heavier This bokken is great for people under 6 feet but the O Bokken might be more appropriate if you are taller or want to get stronger 
Ordered this after breaking a couple of different wooden bokken Great feel to this in terms of weight the handle is longer than I was used to but quickly learned to appreciate that fact 
I previously had some wooden Bokkens that did not last very long at all They both broke within about 3 months of being used This thing is awesome and takes hits like a champ I will most likely be back to buy another one 
I am in no way an experienced swordsman but I feel that this bokken is great It is considerably lighter than an actual katana but I think most bokkens are that way It is very impact resistant to the point of being almost indestructible Once I accidentally hit a support beampillar with full force dont ask  and I found no trace of damage on the bokken The only flaw I see is that polypropylene is not as dense as wood so the bokken is easily damaged by sharp objects and can be cut by bladed weapons This is not really an issue unless you decide to channel musashi and fight a katana with a bokken

I bought this sleeping bag knowing it was too heavy for backpacking thinking it would be worth the extra weight just so I wouldnt be cold during winter camping trips I was wrong First off this bag is enormous Compression sacks do very little for this You WILL have to strap it to the outside of your bag unless you have a milsurp large ALICE bag in which case it will fill over half of the storage space I estimate it takes up 30L of space in its stuff sack Second off this bag is heavy Its heavier than my tent heavier than my backpack Its actually the heaviest thing in my pack Thats somewhat to be expected as a cheap zerodegree bag but lets observe that This is not a zerodegree bag I took it on several camping trips with a low of 32F It is only comfortable if youre fully dressed multiple layers jacket two pairs of socks and a beanie This last trip I went without the jacket and only wore one pair of thick wool socks and was miserably cold all night Note that this was 32F and had the aid of a thermal reflecting sleeping pad The description boasts comfort down to 15F Id argue probable survival at those temps but not a cozy night I was prepared to make some sacrifices in weight to save money and still be warm but in the end I was disappointed in all regards I would rate 1 star but I must admit that it is warmer than my 40F Summer bag and at least on this last trip I didnt die or lose extremities to frostbite I would return this but Ive had it too long and gotten it dirty Be prepared to splurge on your sleeping bag or you will spend the night shivering or worse

We have two of these Coleman North Rim 0Degree Mummy Bags and have used them on numerous trips to the Northern Sierra Nevada and Utah camping trips Prior to using these I have gone through half a dozen others in my life time I think this is one of the best values in sleeping bags out there bar none It absolutely keeps us warm even in fall and winter inside a tent Yes in the camping world of gadgets  the lighter an item is it is disproportionately expensive This sleeping bag is much heftier than very high end ones that are equally warm yet super light But there is an added benefit many look over and that is the heftier a sleeping bag the less of a need for a sleeping pad you have as the bulk and heft will essentially act as a sleeping pad for you In other words this bag is a winner for the vast majority of campers who are casual campers in America myself included Recommended

I purchased two Coleman mummy bags for my boys Scout camping trips I trusted the Coleman brand and these bags seemed right for the price They kept the boys warm and dry all year round During the winter months yes Boy Scouts camp out during the winter too I took them off the ground and had them sleep on a cot inside their tent The bags worked well even in the low teens and snow The only complaint I had with these bags was their compressibility Because of their materials and thickness they do not compress well Many times I found them sticking halfout of a compression sack after a campout But once home they can be rolled out and properly rolled back into the sack My opinion if you want an affordable durable sleeping bag for camping this is a good choice

I do three season hiking in the Appalachian Trail region In early spring and late fall the temperatures can get pretty low I had decided that I wanted a mummy bag previously and began searching for something around the 20 degree range I stumbled upon this bag and given its price thought that it would make a good purchase I believe I made the right choice Pros  This bag is warm While the description states that it is a 0Degree bag I would not suggest using it in that type of weather A lot of individuals see that and believe that they could sleep in 0degree weather comfortably That is not the case My guess is that this bag would be comfortable around 30degrees I have not yet had it out in weather that cold so I cannot say for sure Furthermore in weather that cold I typically place a couple of body or hand warmers in the bag with me You could also use a sleeping bag liner which would make this bag warmer as well For most individuals camping in typical camping weather this bag will be more than enough In order to reach that 0degree rating the bag has a considerable amount of insulation inside of it This makes it fairly comfortable to sleep in I use a selfinflating sleeping pad when I hike The combination of the bag and the pad made for a relatively comfortable nights sleep Cons  As stated above the warmth and comfort is achieved through a generous amount of insulation This also results in the bag being fairly heavy and bulky You will have a difficult time attempting to stuff this into a backpack I use a Teton 5200 and I cannot fit it into the sleeping bag compartment Instead I put it in the main compartment and put my clothes in the sleeping bag compartment If you have the money and will be doing a lot of backpacking I would suggest getting a smaller more manageable bag 
I didnt buy this item on Amazon as Walmart had a good deal on them I finally used it Its not that difficult to put back into its bag Its very soft and comfortable Im 510  170 lbs If you are taller I wouldnt buy it If you are more than 20 lbs heavier I wouldnt buy it either Update Gave it 5 Stars as Ive used it more and its worth the price

After reading all the reviews on here I decided to purchase this sleeping bag for my camping trip this past October I was initially looking to buy an inexpensive sleeping bag for my brother since he didnt have one but I ended up giving him my old Wenzel bag and decided to purchase a newer one for myself I didnt want to spend a lot of money but I didnt want something that was only going to last for one season before falling apart either This Coleman bag fit the bill nicely Since I was pretty much looking to use this particular bag for car camping excursions or short backpacking trips I wasnt as concerned about the weight or bulk of the bag as I normally would be I like the Coleman brand in general and while its definitely not on par with the higher end brand names like The North Face Marmot etc their products do serve their purpose as long as you understand and accept their limitations for what theyre worth This bag is probably too bulky for any real backpacking trips but throw it in the car and its great for car camping and base camp I liked the look of the bag and especially the extra toe space this bag provided After hanging the bag up for a day and letting it air out just to ensure there would be no chemical odors and to allow the bag to loft up I jumped in and my brother and I each tested it out and compared it to my old Wenzel Windy Pass 0degree Mummy Bag from 2008 While both bags offered similar features and comfort I much prefered the zippers on this Coleman bag and found the antisnag feature interesting Overall I found this bag to be comfortable and worth the price Temperatures on our camping trip dropped down to the low 50s at night so I cant really attest to how warm the bag COULD be in colder weather but it was perfectly comfortable on this particular trip Initially I found the bag too hot and had to unzip it open but eventually zipped myself back in as I cooled down and ended up sleeping very well each night of our trip in long underwear in this bag The stuff sack included with the bag is rather large and Im not sure why other reviewers found it difficult to pack it back in I carefully rolled my bag up and packed it in an even smaller compression sack in effort to save space in my car trunk there were 4 of us camping with all my gear packed in my Mazda3 so space was at a premium but it would have been a cinch to just stuff it back into its own included carry sack Overall a good purchase but like others have said probably not the sleeping bag youd want to bring with you on backpacking trips due to its size Great for car camping base camp sleepovers or any other times that space and weight are not an issue In those situations youll probably want to get a higher end sleeping bag for that purpose 
As soon as I opened this bag I had a feeling it wouldnt perform as advertized I often sleep in my backyard so I tried it three times and was chilled enough to come back into the house when the temps hit just the mid to high thirties It doesnt work nearly as well as my last zero degree bag which could take me comfortably down to 1520 degrees Very disappointing Im returning it

I bought this bag and took it out backpacking at White Sands National Monument in NM in Jan A winter storm hit the day before I left and it was COLD out there Im not sure of the exact temperature but I know that it was either high teens or low 20s My waterbottle and my dogs water bowl both completely froze throughout as did the condensation on the outside of my tent and my car was a big ice block when I got back to it in the morning The bag actually did pretty well I pulled the face hole as tight as I could and just cuddled down inside the bag without sticking my face out it was too cold if I put my face out I have Raynauds disease and my handsnailbeds often are very cold and turn blue in cold weather from poor circulation but they were nice and warm inside the bag without extra gloves on I was impressed by that Overall I was ok but not as warm and comfortable as I would have been at home in my own bed of course It did its job and kept my appendages warm enough and me alive in what could have been hypothermia conditions without the proper gear My only real gripe about this bag is that it is huge when its rolled up Its too big to fit into the sleeping bag compartment of my NorthFace backpacking pack so I imagine its too big for any and it takes up a very large portion of the pack when stuffed in the only way it will fit Due to this reason I wish I would have gotten a different bag It would be great for anyone who is just setting up their tent right next to their car but not the best choice for a backpacker

Any sword that is only 15 is in fact very dangerous These swords are called wallhangers because they are only designed to by hung on a wall not swung The reason is that underneath the handle is a very small piece of metal that connects to the blade itself Called the Tang In a real martial arts sword the tang is normally a thick piece of metal that is almost the thickness of the sword itself If you swing a wallhanger too often or too hard it can break at the tang and fly off and hurt someone If you want to learn more about how dangerous these wallhangers are do a google search on the words anatomy of a wallhanger Any sword designed for real martial arts practice like Iaido starts at 250 not 15 and should be bought at a reputable Iaido store sorry I am not allowed to recommend web sites here So be smart either hang this sword back on the wall or throw it out before your baby brothersister hurts someone

As is the case with just about every other cheap bicycle accessory this mirror is made primarily of cheap flexible plastic parts that arent durable and wont last over the long run My particular mirror has gradually come loose over several months The bike nor mirror has not suffered any major spills Instead I often find myself leaning the bike on the left side where the mirror is attached Each time the mirror gently bumps against a wall or car or some other vertical surface which I lean the bike against The mirrors upper hinge has become looser and looser to the point where it now simply flops around and wont hold its place I suppose the mirror is designed with a tiny bit of give or play to allow for easy adjustment as a result the mirror is easy to move and jar loose with even the slightest pressure resulting over time in a loose joint with a lot of play that simply cannot be tightened Its par for the course its a 12 mirror so durability may be too much to ask but there must be a manufacturer out there who can design a mirror that doesnt loosen over time even if it requires selling at a slightly higher price point

They are working perfectly as designed At first installing them and tightening them felt a little disconcerting because its very difficult to tighten them down Then I realized why This design cleverly uses friction to keep the mirror locked in place once you adjust it You just have to make sure you dont over tighten them to the point of breaking the plastic or stripping the threads Just keep feeling how easy it is to move and adjust them as you slowly tighten more and more and they will be perfectly adjusted The slightly parabolic view helps get a wide angle view of traffic Since I drive on the right side of the road I felt a left mounted mirror was enough Please be aware they do make the bike handles wider so you have to be more careful negotiating in narrow areas or you will bump them and have to readjust Not a big deal though

I have one of these on each of my bikes 2 hybrids and one road bike They are great as they are a good size and can be positioned where you need them I especially like it on my road bike as it mounts on the end of the drop down and in ever position it gives me a good view and helps prevent me from being surprised by a vehicle coming up behind me 
This bike mirror really is deserving of the high praise and ratings When I ordered this mirror I also ordered the Hafny Bar End Bike Mirror and the Venzo Handlebar Stainless Steel Mirror The latter two were much smaller in mirror image surface making your rearward view somewhat insufferable Also they werent shabby but their product engineering was inferior to the Mirrycle The Mirrycle is engineered with male hex bolts that screw into microtapered female brass pieces that become tighter and tighter as you screw the hex bolt in place Yes it is a bit difficult to screw the hex bolt into place with the hex key provided but what you get when youre finished is a rearview mirror on your handlebar that does not jiggle Yes it bounces as the handlebar bouncescant avoid the physics of bicycle ridingbut all the jiggle in the mirror is eliminated With the larger mirror surface you get a much better rearward view and you can adjust it with your hand Terrific product and terrific value I wish I had not waited to get this

Nicely made in the USA The plastic is polycarbonate with threaded brass inserts for the screws Assembly was easy as long as the screws were oiled first The threaded brass inserts are slotted and tapered closed inside the plastic This makes them self locking so the screws wont loosen up The screws on mine were going in so tight that they creaked like the door to a haunted house A drop of motor oil helped a lot without defeating the self locking feature The glass mirror pivots and stays where you want it until it gets bumped too hard where it will swing away Nice feature to prevent breakage It is slightly convex for a wider field of view but not a whole lot to severely distort the perception of distance It fits into the hollow end of the handlebar and locks in with a screw activated wedge system

Good quality mirror that works well 
My absolute favorite bike handlebar mirror and Ive tried several 
Just installed the Mirrycle bicycle mirror today and took it for a test run A few observations and comments Agreed assembly is not entirely easy As mentioned by numerous reviews the screws drive hard to the point that you think youre actually cracking the plastic plus the included Allen wrench requires some strength to turn But not to worry Read the instructions and theyll confirm the hard drive and that you will not crack the plastic I didnt try WD40 or any other lubricant so cannot say if that would ease the assembly I installed the Mirrycle onto a GT hybrid bicycle and after using a Dremel tool to create an opening in the end of my handle grip I found the handlebar opening accepted the smaller of the two wedges for mounting I chose to follow the alternative down and under installation mentioned on Amazon reviews which is quite clever and works very well however I believe you may get a better site picture using the normal above and to the side installation which would facilitate not having to move your eyes so far from your frontal path to do so The primary disadvantage to the normal upandout installation is that the mirror really sticks out there very exposed and ifwhen you dump your bike or ride close to any shrubs etc your mirror will be the early casualty plus the storage shed where we keep our bikes is small which would necessitate tucking the mirror in upon each return Do whichever works best for you From the lower mounting position I could see both myself and directly behind me but I dont believe that provides the maximum field of view On my initial trip I stopped a couple times to adjust the mirror in a similar manner to what you would do with a car ie if you can see part of yourselfyour bike in the mirror tilt it out just a little further until you cant and that should be about right Once adjusted properly you only need to tilt your head a tad one way to see either part of yourself directly behind the mirror or a tad the other way to see much more of the road to your direct left I was amazed at how solid this mirror rode exhibiting absolutely no jitter or vibration The large convex shape offered a wide clear field of view which allowed me not only to see what was coming from behind me but also what was to the near left rear of me as well This was only my first day with this product but Im impressed with the quality and the flexible mounting options it offers 
These work real well Ive had several on different bikes 
This has got to be the best 15ish dollars Ive put into my bike so far For anyone wondering I use the Radmini electric bike from RAD POWER BIKES and this fits I would imagine this fits most bikes because it comes with two different adapters Make sure you do not drop with the mirror sticking out this mirror is made of glass not plastic it will shatter If it does happen I noticed amazon sells replacements for 7 bucks which isnt horrible

I installed one of these on my mountain bike fifteen years ago Survived lots of heavy trail riding banging into trees etc Recently the plastic stem finally cracked and I was delighted to find out that the same Mirrycle MTB bar end mount design is still available Not surprising I guess since they pretty much nailed it the first time The mirror is large enough to provide an excellent view of the whole road behind Unlike smaller mirrors or helmetmounted mirrors this model doesnt require your head to be in exactly the right position to see the road behind you No way cars will sneak up on you with this model Installation is very simple and adjustment is almost as easy as adjusting side mirrors on a car although youll probably want to use a tool to really tighten it into position once its angled exactly as you want it As I mentioned durability for me has been outstanding The arm holds the mirror out a few inches from the end of the handlebar which is great for visibility but if you ride narrow trails with trees or cliffs really tight on the sides theres a chance youll scrape the mirror on obstacles from time to time Ive had this happen but I just twist the mirror back into position Great visibility outstanding durability inexpensive An excellent investment in riding safety 
Works great  makes me feel a lot safer on the streets

I installed this a couple of weeks ago This mirror is well designed and exceeded my expectations When I first started installing it I thought it was defective because I could not get the threads of the screws to start I tried grinding the starter thread because it would not start more than a 12 turn Then I remembered what I had read when I ordered it and looked at the instructions The tight threads are this way by design This allows you to adjust the mirror while riding so that you can get it exactly where you want it The alternative would be very difficult You would have to adjust then ride then adjust and readjust every time it would get moved Or the screws would back out when the mirror gets turned The mirror will allow you to see oncoming traffic on both sides of the road or regardless of whether you riding with or against traffic because it has a wide field of view An excellent value for the money The only thing I would like to see different is the type of plastic The plastic in the mirror mount I bought is hard and probably brittle I suspect it will break if I drop the bike or otherwise strike the mount with any appreciable force The brittle hard plastic is no doubt necessary to facilitate the tight threads so the female threaded portion wont come loose or break free inside the plastic when tightening A think a better but no doubt more expensive design would incorporate some flexibility to avoid breakage 
Best mirror out there for the money Sticks out far enough so you can see behind you Inexpensive but worth every dime You MUST know what is behind you and YOU CANNOT KEEP TURNING YOUR HEAD TO FIND OUT

This mirror is good got it and put it together right out of the box really easy The directions and the diagram to put it togeher are simple like ikea Put it togther lightly then tightened it up after adjusting it but a word to the wise dont crank down on the screws just tighten about an 18th that give the mirror some movement for adjustment not too tight because then you wont be able to tweak it in and if it moves a little you can tweak it back into placebut make sure its not loose either because and movement such as a bump will throw the mirror out of alignment Remember lightly tighten it not crank it It seems strong but dont know how it will hold up if my bike falls over and there is a direct hit Hope i dont find outBut overall it seems really sturdy

EDIT After 5000 miles commuting on the Wisconsin frozen winter the plastic on the L elbow cracked off probably due to cold temperatures single digit F and below zero and vibrations of those amazingly well paved POS Wisconsin roads mirror flew off so good for casual riding in warmer weather but useless in the long run in cold just get a DOT approved mirror made out of metal a bit heavier but it will be dependable and plastic wont crack This is the 2nd mirror that this has happened to me hence why I am updating my review Original review Wish they had a wide angle portionsection in the mirror area other than that they work great Simple to install yet sturdy to withstand daily commutes 
Bought one of these for my 10 speed vintage Schwinn Now I have one for the mountain bike as well These are the best mirrors I purchased and Ive gone through half a dozen 
After buying two other brands of bike mirrors then having to throw them all away this one is the Holy Grail The biggest problem with all the others in my opinion is the fact that every time you hit a friggin bump you have to readjust the mirror Very bad But with this little gem the tightening screws are so firmly secured that once you adjust it the mirror STAYS PUT The secret is in the screw bolts they intentionally made them to fit extremely snugly into the holes making the holding power of this unit incredibly strong In fact had I not read the directions mentioning how hard you have to tighten them with the little wrench they provide you I would have thought that they were the wrong size and immediately returned the entire unit But thats exactly how they were designed to fit you wont break the plastic when you really bear down hard to tighten everything together In fact if you have weak hands you might want to enlist someone with a more powerful grip to do the entire job for you The results are totally worth it

The Mirrycle MTB Bar End Mountain Bicycle Mirror is the bike mirror Ive been looking for Its fully adjustable it comes with easy to understand installation instructions that make it easy to install its lightweight and its built with quality materials This mirror is designed to resist breakage and I can testify to the fact that it takes more than a couple pretty nasty spills to break the mirror or the sectional mounting arms And should you survive a crash that the mirror doesnt Mirrycle includes a parts replacement list that makes it easy to order very reasonably priced parts Ive used a couple different helmet mirrors and a mirror that attaches to eyeglass frames but this one has them all beat Finally with this little beauty attached to your handlebar youll be able to clearly see any rear approaching threat

Does a great job on our bicycles 
Best MTBATB bike mirror ever Accept no substitutes This thing attaches to the end of the bar with some opposing wedgeshaped pieces with a long sockethead bolt going through them and a barrel nut squeezing them together As the screw gets tightened the wedge pieces expand out towards the tube walls on the handlebars This creates an anchor 23 inches or so into the end of the handle Once its in this thing is not moving until you loosen the bolt Assembly and attachment is very easy and takes only minutes Everything you need to attach this onto your handlebars is included but you will need a utility knife to cut a hole in any rubberplastic grips you have Includes both a larger and smaller wedge piece to accommodate different sized bars Highquality build and finish As good as a car mirror 
The slightest jarring on the scooter knocks this thing out of whack so you have to constantly reset it 
Works as well as could be expected  while going over bumps changing sitting position etcyou change the angle and what youll see in the mirror So Ive got mine set to view behind me while Im in my most common position The mirror was easy to install and took just a few minutes I think it is built well enough but it certainly isnt intended to survive lots of drops and collisions with pavement It is easy to adjust and it generally holds its position once set tree branches or big bumps can mean I need to occasionally readjust But I really find it handy and it helps me keep an eye on cars when crossing roads as some car drivers seem to find bike riders invisible

The Mirrycle mirror is a mixed bag for me The mounting system and adjustment pivots are top notch its an easy to use design and very tolerant of abuse However Im not a fan of the mirror itself the field of view is too small for me My advice is buy the Cateye MTB mirror which has an excellent slightly wideangle oval shaped mirror and glue it to the Mirrycle That way you get the best mirror and the best mounting system in one Happy riding

The Pros  Does what it is supposed to  Glass so it shouldnt scratch easily  Fairly easy to assemble and mount  Does not look terrible  Lightweight The Cons  Instructions could be better First off I am VERY glad I bought this I feel much safer riding this mirror gives me a great view of what is behind me without constantly having to look over my shoulder It actually works better than I expected but to be honest for the price I did not expect much so I was pleasantly surprised Which is always nice What you should know As much as I like it you should know that the instructions are not very good and when assembling it it felt like it was going to break The screws dont seem to be a very good fit Dont get me wrong they do fit it does end up okay but it was VERY hard to tighten and it kept feeling like it was going to crack or break while putting it together The instructions were not very clear but I figured it out Once installed it seems great I have only had it on for about a week or so but so far no complaints and I am very happy with this purchase PS Some people said they had to mutilate their handles to get it on That was NOT the case for me I have a Trek mountain bike and the end of the handle had a plastic cap I was able to remove very easily and the mirror mount fit in perfectly and tightened on perfectly I guess it depends on the bike but this seemed to be built perfectly for me Trek 
Absolutely love this mirror  so easy to install and works like a charm  not only can i see my son riding on the trailer bike behind me but also my daughter and my wife on their bikes 20 to 30 feet behind me I am recommending this to anyone seriously riding on bike trails and streets

Ive had experience with these on a recumbent trike so when I got a new fat bike this was something I immediately missed so I ordered a set and installed them and I can safely ride without constantly looking over my shoulder once again If you have grips with plugs in the end then you just pop out the plugs and slide the mirrors in otherwise you will have to cut the end out of your grips but once you slide these in you will never know you had to cut your grips I believe that if your riding on the road you should have a mirror of some kind and these should work for just about anyone 
excellent mirror 
Easy to install Other reviewers made me apprehensive but I managed with no problem If my bike gets knocked over Im sure the mirror will break but Im careful I love seeing whats behind me without having to turn around 
If you want a bike mirror look no furtherseriously Its well made solid and holds its position while riding over paved roads and rough terrain alike I just dont understand the people that write that it moves around as they ride The field of view is perfect for the size and gives the rider all the info you need at a glance Its multi adjustments assures a perfect POV for all size riders When you assemble it prior to installing it on your bike youll notice the brass threads that you screw the Allen bolts into The brass is a softer metal and makes for a tighter fitso as you assemble the mirror dont be discouraged as to how hard it is to screw the bolts into the threadsits meant to be like that It comes with the Allen wrench so you can leave it in your seat bag if you need it The only time I loosen it up is to turn the bike upside down to adjust something or fix a tire For the money I cant see why anyone would buy a different brand of mirror If you dont hit it on something or drop your bike this mirror will last 20 years no problem 
As far as Im concerned if you ride in the road and you dont have a rearview mirror youre asking to get run over Those helmet mirrors might be good for some people but I dont think you can beat a well placed handlebar mounted mirror This thing has enough options for placement and adjustability that Im sure it would work well on a lot of different types of bikes I had mine on a Trek 800 mountain bike You know how when you look over your shoulder to the left your shoulders naturally follow Well that can lead to you pulling your bike to the left and possibly losing control in the middle of the road Its happened to me and Ive almost been hit because of it Stay aware and stay safe Keep your rubber on the road 
This is THE answer 
Very solid construction Instructions are great and even tell you that its going to be tight and dont worry because you wont break it Mirror does exactly what you would expect and is very solid Love it Wasnt super happy about cutting my brand new handlebar grips but it was worth it 

I almost returned this product because the screws were very difficult to get in and I didnt want to strip the barrel but its a nice mirror Also the wedge is a great idea but takes some figuring out and the instructions suck That aside once its on your bike its easily adjustable and a high quality glass so you can see very well It doesnt really work for road bikes though because when you have the mirror that low since your handlebars bend down you can barely see 
I wanted a mirror but I wanted to keep it small and this fills that need nicely The mirror is convex so it shows a fairly large area behind and yet its not too strongly curved so the things I want to see are big enough to recognize It arrived in a very small box because its completely disassembled but it was quick and easy to assemble and to mount very securely on the end of my handlebar There are really only two small issues that keep me from giving it 5 stars Its nearly impossible to adjust the mirror while ridingthere are cap screws holding everything tightso it took some trial and error to find the best position And because its small and right on the end of the handlebar it took some experimenting to find a position that wouldnt show my a lot of my forearm at the expense of overtaking vehicles But knowing what I know now Id gladly buy it again
